beer.beer_description: Over the years we have toned down the malt grist while upping the hop profile, creating am America Pale Ale, rich and fruity, yet finishes crisp. We're sure that you'll love the copper amber color and medium body.

Our company founder Carl Dinkelacker would be proud of our pleasantly bitter Pilsner, which continues to bear his initials in his honour. Our brewers’ recipe for success: a great deal of passion and the best regional ingredients. The beer's tart, fresh scent and its floral hop bitterness are provided by the finest Tettnanger hops. The selected malts and our fresh brewing water give Dinkelacker CD Pils its unique characteristics.

With an additional MD honey prime, this Bière de Garde Gold is brewed with 100% MD grown grains to create a bright, fruity and malty  backbone with faint caramel and biscuit character. Complex and full bodied with a soft and dry finish, this beer is the perfect transition to Fall.

German Style Hefeweizen with Maryland Brewers Gold hops, Pilsner and Wheat malts and Hefeweizen yeast. This traditional Hefeweizen has a mild banana nose with soft clove on the palate that is rounded out with a malty wheat finish

The Cracker Cowboys of Florida were colonial-era settlers, often of Scots-Irish descent, who arrived in Florida when Spain traded their territory of La Florida to the English. The term Cracker in Florida usage relates to the whip these "cow hunters" used to herd cattle in Florida's Palmetto Prairies. Called Quaqueros by the Spanish, these hardy and hard working Cracker Cowboys helped to shape the history of Florida, the nation's oldest cattle raising state. We brew Florida Cracker White Ale with unmalted wheat, orange peel and coriander and then ferment it with a Belgian yeast strain to give it a spicy and dry finish. Perfect for a warm day on the Palmetto Prairie.

Our spring seasonal is a refreshing light to medium bodied golden ale. Brewed with honey, hibiscus, and chamomile, fruity subtleties abound despite the accessible and easy drinking nature of this beer. Honey imparts a subtle floral note as well as a touch of sweetness.

With a big dose of Madagascar Vanilla this American Robust Porter also features Maryland Cascade hops, Zeus hops, black patent malt, chocolate malt and Chico yeast. The dark chocolate and molasses nose is complimented by a slight hop fruitiness creating a comforting and complex finish with a touch of sweetness.
Wheat Ale brewed with locally sourced Pawpaws.
Our Spinks Ferry Saison with added dried Hibiscus flower resulting in a wonderful floral bouquet and a beautiful pinkish red color.

Deadly Rhythm, by its very name, creates a graceful balance between Pacific Northwest hops and a blend of American and English malts. Floral and fruity hop aromas provide the introduction to the lightly toasted malt backbone of this beer. This American pale ale finishes dry with a smooth but lingering bitterness.
Rotating brewmaster hop selection...the 2018 hop is Azacca to complement the earthy, spicy, peppery finish of the rye.
Crisp, light, smooth, easy drinking beverage

Sour Season is Open:
This Gose is brewed with cantaloupe and black lava sea salt for a resfreshing mix of savory and tart while an addition of oak-smoked wheat to the grain bill adds hints of smoke to the finish for a sophisticated, yet highly refreshing brew. The choice of orange and black ingredients is no coincidence, where we come from, these are the colors of summer! Step up to plate and swig away!
English Style Bitter with Maryland Cascade hops, Carroll County wild flower honey and Chico yeast.  Traditional English Style bitter with a delicate hop balance of earth and spice.

Some people say pumpkins are fruit. Other people say pumpkins are
vegetables. We say...they’re tasty! So we brewed our fall-spiced
hefeweizen with pure pumpkin– a truly delicious fruiveggie!
American spiced ale with pumpkin.
Easy drinking lightly hopped ale utilizing all centennial hops. A Bayside favorite.
Citrus, grassy, and slight perfume hop character balanced with a sweet malt body.

This beer is a traditional Berliner Weisse with white peach puree added into the brite tank.  Clean lactic acid sourness from the bacteria used in fermentation is balanced by doughy wheat and subtle peach sweetness.  Tangy and refreshing, this beer is perfect for the hot beer garden weather.
Belgian Farmhouse with Maryland Brewers Gold hops, Carroll County wild flower honey, chamomile and Trappist Ale yeast. Light and refreshing with notes of spice and a touch of fruit

beer.beer_name: Tropical Tarts McGee (Mango, Passion Fruit, & Guava)

beer.beer_description: Originally from Cologne, Germany. This beer is a clear, top-fermented beer with a bright, straw-yellow hue similar to other beers brewed from mainly Pilsener malt. Light, crisp and perfect for a summer day!
Black Widow is fruit-forward, yet tart, with a tantalizing complexity, made with blackberries and freshly pressed New York apples.

SeaQuench Ale is a session sour mash-up of a crisp Kolsch, a salty Gose, and a tart Berliner Weiss brewed in sequence with black limes, sour lime juice and sea salt to make this the most thirst-quenching beer Dogfish Head has ever brewed.

This Irish Red pays homage to one of our favorite Irish farmers, Tom's cousin Jimmy Nelly. With MD Grown two row and roasted barley From Dark Cloud, this delightfully malty Red is a true MHB favorite!

Brewed with 100% Maryland grown grain from our friends at Dark Cloud Malthouse, the latest in our Green Farmer series has a wet hop of our very own Chinooks! Complex with bright fruit notes of white grape and bold citrus make this Green Farmer the best yet!

Brewed with the second runnings of our upcoming Bière de Noe,l this Saison is meant to celebrate the Fall Equinox. Soft and elegant with restrained bitterness, the warmth and spice of this Saison is perfect for shorter days and cooler nights. Joyeux équinoxe!
A crisp refreshing blonde ale that is slightly malty and balanced out with centennial and cascade hops.

A golden colored ale with crisp malt character and a slightly spicy hop aroma. We use a good amount of wheat and some German malt in this one to give it a very refreshing taste. Avenue Ale is a true session beer, so sit down and prepare for a long one.
A Biere de Coupage of an 8 month old sour Kentucky Common and our Berliner Weisse. Notes of tangerine and lemon with a hint of corn sweetness.

Brewed with North American ingredients, including Pacific Northwest hops, as well as our classic Guinness yeast, Guinness Blonde is a crisp, golden beer. It has a noticeable but gentle hop aroma of citrus and tropical fruits, clean cracker-bread malt flavor and a pleasantly bitter refreshing finish. Brewed at the Guinness Open Gate Brewery & Barrel House in Baltimore, Maryland.

Our HomeSTATE Hefeweizen with a citrus twist! Lemon balm and lemon peel add a refreshing new layer to this German Style Hefeweizen with 100% Maryland grown ingredients. This local interpretation of our traditional Hefeweizen has a faint banana nose with soft clove on the palate that is rounded out with a malty wheat finish and a late honey sweetness from the local malt.

A refreshing neo-Berliner Weisse, Festina Pêche is available during the sweaty months.

Sadly, there are only a few breweries left in Berlin still brewing the Berliner Weisse style, which is characterized by its intense tartness (some say sour). There were once over 70 breweries in Berlin alone making this beer!

In addition to fermentation with an ale yeast, Berliner Weisse is traditionally fermented with lactic cultures to produce its acidic (or green apple-like) character. Served as an apertif or summertime quencher, Festina is delicately hopped and has a pale straw color. To soften the intense sourness, Berliner Weisse is traditionally served with a dash of essence of woodruff or raspberry syrup.

In Festina Pêche, since the natural peach sugars are eaten by the yeast, the fruit complexity is woven into both the aroma and the taste of the beer so there is no need to doctor it with woodruff or raspberry syrup. Just open and enjoy!

Our classic Dollyhyde Farmhouse aged in a Honey Jack barrel from Tenth Ward distillery is back! Lightly oaked with an extra touch of honey and vanilla, this Farmhouse is just right for a Summer afternoon!

With an ambush of dry hops, this crisp, refreshing, summertime beer goes down smooth with a soft, rounded-out blend of hops backed with a slight caramel sweetness. What sets this beer apart from other pale ales is the highly aggressive dry-hopping method using all four hops, which gives the beer an exploding bouquet of fresh hop aroma and flavor without all the bitterness..
An agave/lime gose brewed with fresh pressed limes. With subtle after-notes of salt, it will delight your senses
Light blonde with refreshing lemon, lime, and orange.
This beer uses a basic malt bill of 2-row and wheat malt. It is lightly hopped with European hops to let the fresh raspberry flavor shine through.

This German Sour Ale becomes an American quencher with the addition of Watermelon puree from California.  The tart, salty, sourness coming from a process called kettle-souring with lactobacillius, giving the beer a dry crisp quality is a perfect sunshine complement to the watermelon puree added at the end of the process.

After 15 months in a red wine barrel with blackberries, the farmhouse base beer was blended with our Fieldhand Tart Table Beer. Tart, refreshing and complex, this Blended Blackberry Sour is the first in a new Barrel Blend Series!

Brewed with all Maryland grown and malted Thoroughbred 6-row barley from Chesapeake Malting, Newport hops in the kettle from Peterson Farms in New York, and an aromatic dry hop of Cascade from Big Truck Farm in Baltimore County.

Lemony, Crisp, Beachy. A Belgian beer made for miners & factory workers. The perfect accessory for hours in a parking lot eating wings & playing Cornhole.

Hops: Horizon, Saaz

Malts: Pilsner, Wheat, Acid Malt
Collaboration brewed with Flying Dog - a pale ale made with 100% local malt from Chesapeake and Dark Cloud, as well as local paw paw fruits and honey and Galaxy hops.
Beer from the Rarities Summer 2018 Collection. Czech Pilsner .
Double the OLD BAY and spice it up with OLD BAY hot.
